item.title: Blanc-arita
item.description:
• 2 oz silver tequila
  • ½ oz blanc vermouth
  • ½ oz lime juice
  • ½ oz agave syrup
  • 1 dash orange bitters
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

item.title: Vigo
item.description:
I didn’t invent this drink, but I did invent the name.
  • 2 oz orange juice
  • 1 oz London dry gin
  • 1 oz blanc vermouth
  • ¼ oz honey syrup
  • 2 oz sparkling wine
Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake then strain into a wine glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Be disappointed by Mimosas for the rest of your life.

item.title: Martini
item.description:
Everyone has an opinion about martinis. I’ll spare you mine, and just give you my recipe. Trust me.

I often use a blanc vermouth instead of the traditional dry, but it’s delicious with either. Any type of gin works in a martini, but I prefer a sweeter style.

  • 2¼ oz genever gin
  • ¾ oz dry vermouth
Add to cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Stir well, then strain into a martini glass.

Garnish with a lemon twist.
